meanings.definition: In widespread existence, practice, or use; prevalent.
meanings.sent1: The playground was rife with laughter and joy.
meanings.sent2: During the holiday season, the streets are rife with colorful decorations.
meanings.sent3: The classroom was rife with excitement as the students prepared for the surprise quiz.
meanings.sent4: The forest was rife with the songs of birds, creating a symphony of nature.
meanings.sent5: The market was rife with the aroma of freshly baked bread, tempting all who passed by.

meanings.sent1: The garden was rife with blooming flowers of every color.
meanings.sent2: The library shelves were rife with books on various subjects.
meanings.sent3: The party was rife with delicious food and lively music.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was rife with creative ideas, ready to be brought to life.
meanings.sent5: The city was rife with opportunities for those willing to explore and take risks.
